author: Scott Lundegren
comment: Nice looking but its missing an critical feature.  When doing interval training such as Sprints, there is a warm up and cool down phase.  Most other phone timers include this as part of the cycle.  It's really not usable without this.

author: Pete Luxford
comment: Don't really see the user of this. Unless I'm missing something. It doesn't vibrate when intervals are over, or change color woken intervals are over so you have to keep reading the watch. The only notification odd a beep through the phone, do you might as well just use a phone app. Needs to focus more on function, not design.
title: Missing key features

author: Saman Sahraei
comment: The app is very simple and useful and is exactly what I was looking for. The only thing I would change is to make the alarm customizable. It only vibrates 5 sec before the time and I need to be notified 10 sec before the lap is ending.
title: Simple nice app

author: Allilang S
comment: Nice look but missing too much. Can't see remaing time over 1 minute. Can't see how many reps are completed or remaining. No ringsound in my blutooth headset. No way to set a warning buzzer time.
title: Too little

author: Chris Haines
comment: It would be nice if you could hide it from the phone's app drawer. There is no need to see it there. It's just clutter.
title: Works well

author: Paulo Gatchalian
comment: Decent enough if it's running in the foreground, but not in sync and doesn't always vibrate if the watch goes into ambient mode. What's the point of a vibrating notification if you have to keep the app in the foreground all the time for it to work properly?

author: Through My Eyes
comment: It's great and works perfect on my asus zenwatch 2 but it's missing a feature to repeat the timer with a end rest period.
title: Better if...

author: Elmer M
comment: Minimun resting time is 10sec, the up is good but if the minimun resting time could go to 0 would be perfect. Thanks
title: Minimun Resting time is 10sec, better to be 0

author: Timothy Galea
comment: Doesn't persist, must run in foreground on watch

author: Jesús Abarca
comment: Does exactly what it says
title: Great app

author: Pyitphyoe Phyoe
comment: Phyoe 30
title: Pyitphyoe

author: Matthew Liggett
comment: Can I choose to have less warning when the interval is ending?  My wrist buzzes for so long that with short intervals it's buzzing nearly all the time.  I'd prefer a quick double or triple buzz, or perhaps some noise, right when the interval ends.
title: Good

author: Tom Somerville
comment: It's pretty good, however I would like to be able to use another timer jn my workout to alternate to other leg for example so I would like to be able to do 30 work - 30 work - 15 rest
title: Use it all the time, hope for improvement

author: Jason Zhang
comment: But the UI on the phone is confusing
title: Work fine

author: Martin Nasution
comment: This is the interval timer app that i've been looking for. And also free but not all of them. But overall still ok.
title: Nice app and work flawlessly on my Moto360

author: Dewayne Korth
comment: Not moving to watch fast enough
title: Doesn't support LG g watch

author: Josh Rivner
comment: Great timer that does not need to be set up on the phone. Completely free unless you want additional color themes!
title: Great interval timer for Wear and it is free

author: Mathew Farber
comment: Seems to be having issues since 5.0.2 update.

author: Daniel Laureano
comment: Simple, easy and works. Anything beyond that should be. Perfect for boxing (using with your smartphone alarm, course).
title: Just Work

author: Andy Gates
comment: Solid interval timer, visually lovely. The only development I'd like is the ability to save preset interval combos.

author: Mark S
comment: Add a step counter and you'll be 10/10, 5/5

author: TRI DUNG DAO
comment: Very good for interval running

author: Serhii Aksiutin
comment: The app always crashes if kill it and then open it by tapping on the its icon in Phone's apps menu. Please add turning off the workout, for those who use the rest ONLY
title: Moto360/Nexus5 - Nice app. Crash report. It's really FREE

author: Kenneth Brandon
comment: Great job, worked exactly as expected and nice design!
title: Works great on my moto360

author: Erick Villacorta
comment: All you download is a store.

reply.author: Aeus Tech, Inc.
reply.content: Erick, this app is designed for Android Wear watches. The timer and 2 basic themes are free. The app you will see on the phone is just a companion app where you can unlock additional themes for the interval timer.

title: Not free

author: sodaJ3RK
comment: App works as intended. Easy and simple to use. However, the only draw back is the screen has to stay on in order for it to work. When you try to turn off the screen, the app turns off as well. Hope the devs could figure out a way to allow the app to work while in standy mode because this will drain the battery even more. 4/5
title: Almost 5

author: DYNA Logix
comment: Bubble cloud launcher users would appreciate if the app would let the screen turn off. If they need, they can start WIT in sticky open mode. thx
title: Keeps screen on unnecessarily

author: Refpasarét Gyerekek
comment: I use Bubble Cloud Widget's mini launcher on the watch, I'd like to be able to sticky start interval timer.  thx
title: Why keep screen on?

author: Robert Couture
comment: Gui doesn't display all the information needed that's readable at a quick glance.

reply.author: Aeus Tech, Inc.
reply.content: Robert, thanks for the feedback. It's really challenging to fit all that info in a small watch screen without sacrificing readability. If you have some suggestions, please feel free to contact us at: info@aeustech.com

title: K.I.S.S.

author: Anton Damianos
comment: Would love a warm up/warmdown option so it contains your complete workout
